measured_by: Need for Cognition subscale of the REI-10
justification: The method section states that participants "completed a short version of the Rational-Experiential Inventory (REI-10)... The Rational-Experiential Inventory is composed of two sub scales -Need for Cognition (NFC) and Faith in Intuition (FI)."

measured_by: Faith in Intuition subscale of the REI-10
justification: The article notes that the REI-10 “is composed of two sub scales -Need for Cognition (NFC) and Faith in Intuition (FI)," indicating that Faith in Intuition is assessed through this specific REI-10 subscale.
Participants "completed ... a short version of the Narcissistic Personality Inventory (NPI-16, Ames et al., 2006)," which the authors use to assess narcissistic tendencies.

The method section includes “a single self-criticism item (‘I tend to be very self-critical’), scored on a scale from 1 (strongly agree) to 7 (strongly disagree),” showing how self-criticism was measured.
During each RDM trial, “participants had to indicate ... their confidence in their response using a 0-100% analogue scale,” demonstrating that confidence was measured with this scale.
